014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.internal;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
017import java.lang.reflect.Method;
018import java.lang.reflect.Parameter;
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.Iterator;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
024import java.util.function.Function;
025import java.util.function.Supplier;
026import java.util.stream.IntStream;
027import java.util.stream.Stream;
028
029import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
030import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
031import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.HandleSupplier;
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericTypes;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.IterableLike;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapper;
035import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultIterable;
036import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultIterator;
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.PreparedBatch;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.UnableToCreateStatementException;
040import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.SingleValue;
041import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.UnableToCreateSqlObjectException;
042import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.BatchChunkSize;
043import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.GetGeneratedKeys;
044import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.SqlBatch;
045import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.UseRowMapper;
046import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.statement.UseRowReducer;
047
048public class SqlBatchHandler extends CustomizingStatementHandler<PreparedBatch> {
049    private final SqlBatch sqlBatch;
050    private final SqlBatchHandler.ChunkSizeFunction batchChunkSize;
051    private final Function<PreparedBatch, ResultIterator<?>> batchIntermediate;
052    private final ResultReturner magic;
053
054    public SqlBatchHandler(Class<?> sqlObjectType, Method method) {
055        super(sqlObjectType, method);
056
057        if (method.isAnnotationPresent(UseRowReducer.class)) {
058            throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot declare @UseRowReducer on a @SqlUpdate method.");
059        }
060
061        this.sqlBatch = method.getAnnotation(SqlBatch.class);
062        this.batchChunkSize = determineBatchChunkSize(sqlObjectType, method);
063        final GetGeneratedKeys getGeneratedKeys = method.getAnnotation(GetGeneratedKeys.class);
064
065        if (getGeneratedKeys == null) {
066            if (!returnTypeIsValid(method.getReturnType())) {
067                throw new UnableToCreateSqlObjectException(invalidReturnTypeMessage(method));
068            }
069            Function<PreparedBatch, ResultIterator<?>> modCounts = PreparedBatch::executeAndGetModCount;
070            batchIntermediate = method.getReturnType().equals(boolean[].class)
071                    ? mapToBoolean(modCounts)
072                    : modCounts;
073            magic = ResultReturner.forOptionalReturn(sqlObjectType, method);
074        } else {
075            String[] columnNames = getGeneratedKeys.value();
076            magic = ResultReturner.forMethod(sqlObjectType, method);
077
078            if (method.isAnnotationPresent(UseRowMapper.class)) {
079                RowMapper<?> mapper = rowMapperFor(method.getAnnotation(UseRowMapper.class));
080                batchIntermediate = batch -> batch.executeAndReturnGeneratedKeys(columnNames)
081                        .map(mapper)
082                        .iterator();
083            } else {
084                batchIntermediate = batch -> batch.executeAndReturnGeneratedKeys(columnNames)
085                        .mapTo(magic.elementType(batch.getConfig()))
086                        .iterator();
087            }
088        }
089    }
090
091    @Override
092    public void warm(ConfigRegistry config) {
093        super.warm(config);
094        magic.warm(config);
095    }
096
097    private Function<PreparedBatch, ResultIterator<?>> mapToBoolean(Function<PreparedBatch, ResultIterator<?>> modCounts) {
098        return modCounts.andThen(iterator -> new ResultIterator<Boolean>() {
099            @Override
100            public boolean hasNext() {
101                return iterator.hasNext();
102            }
103
104            @Override
105            public Boolean next() {
106                return ((Integer) iterator.next()) > 0;
107            }
108
109            @Override
110            public void close() {
111                iterator.close();
112            }
113
114            @Override
115            public StatementContext getContext() {
116                return iterator.getContext();
117            }
118        });
119    }
120
121    private SqlBatchHandler.ChunkSizeFunction determineBatchChunkSize(Class<?> sqlObjectType, Method method) {
122        // this next big if chain determines the batch chunk size. It looks from most specific
123        // scope to least, that is: as an argument, then on the method, then on the class,
124        // then default to Integer.MAX_VALUE
125
126        int batchChunkSizeParameterIndex = indexOfBatchChunkSizeParameter(method);
127        if (batchChunkSizeParameterIndex >= 0) {
128            return new ParamBasedChunkSizeFunction(batchChunkSizeParameterIndex);
129        } else if (method.isAnnotationPresent(BatchChunkSize.class)) {
130            final int size = method.getAnnotation(BatchChunkSize.class).value();
131            if (size <= 0) {
132                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Batch chunk size must be >= 0");
133            }
134            return new ConstantChunkSizeFunction(size);
135        } else if (sqlObjectType.isAnnotationPresent(BatchChunkSize.class)) {
136            final int size = sqlObjectType.getAnnotation(BatchChunkSize.class).value();
137            return new ConstantChunkSizeFunction(size);
138        } else {
139            return new ConstantChunkSizeFunction(Integer.MAX_VALUE);
140        }
141    }
142
143    private int indexOfBatchChunkSizeParameter(Method method) {
144        Annotation[][] parameterAnnotations = method.getParameterAnnotations();
145        return IntStream.range(0, parameterAnnotations.length)
146                .filter(i -> Stream.of(parameterAnnotations[i]).anyMatch(BatchChunkSize.class::isInstance))
147                .findFirst()
148                .orElse(-1);
149    }
150
151    @Override
152    PreparedBatch createStatement(Handle handle, String locatedSql) {
153        return handle.prepareBatch(locatedSql);
154    }
155
156    @Override
157    void configureReturner(PreparedBatch stmt, SqlObjectStatementConfiguration cfg) {}
158
159    @Override
160    Type getParameterType(Parameter parameter) {
161        Type type = super.getParameterType(parameter);
162
163        if (!parameter.isAnnotationPresent(SingleValue.class)) {
164            Class<?> erasedType = GenericTypes.getErasedType(type);
165            if (Iterable.class.isAssignableFrom(erasedType)) {
166                return GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(type, Iterable.class).get();
167            } else if (Iterator.class.isAssignableFrom(erasedType)) {
168                return GenericTypes.findGenericParameter(type, Iterator.class).get();
169            } else if (GenericTypes.isArray(type)) {
170                return ((Class<?>) type).getComponentType();
171            }
172        }
173
174        return type;
175    }
176
177    @Override
178    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ExcessiveMethodLength")
179    public Object invoke(Object target, Object[] args, HandleSupplier h) {
180        final Handle handle = h.getHandle();
181        final String sql = locateSql(handle);
182        final int chunkSize = batchChunkSize.call(args);
183        final Iterator<Object[]> batchArgs = zipArgs(getMethod(), args);
184
185        final class BatchChunkIterator implements ResultIterator<Object> {
186            private ResultIterator<?> batchResult = null;
187            private boolean closed = false;
188
189            BatchChunkIterator() {
190                if (batchArgs.hasNext()) {
191                    // if arguments are present, preload the next result chunk
192                    batchResult = loadChunk();
193                }
194            }
195
196            private ResultIterator<?> loadChunk() {
197                // execute a single chunk and buffer
198                List<Object[]> currArgs = new ArrayList<>();
199                for (int i = 0; i < chunkSize && batchArgs.hasNext(); i++) {
200                    currArgs.add(batchArgs.next());
201                }
202                Supplier<PreparedBatch> preparedBatchSupplier = () -> createPreparedBatch(handle, sql, currArgs);
203                return executeBatch(handle, preparedBatchSupplier);
204            }
205
206            private PreparedBatch createPreparedBatch(Handle handle, String sql, List<Object[]> currArgs) {
207                PreparedBatch batch = handle.prepareBatch(sql);
208                for (Object[] currArg : currArgs) {
209                    applyCustomizers(batch, currArg);
210                    batch.add();
211                }
212                return batch;
213            }
214
215            @Override
216            public boolean hasNext() {
217                if (closed) {
218                    throw new IllegalStateException("closed");
219                }
220                // first, any elements already buffered?
221                if (batchResult != null) {
222                    if (batchResult.hasNext()) {
223                        return true;
224                    }
225                    // no more in this chunk, release resources
226                    batchResult.close();
227                }
228                // more chunks?
229                if (batchArgs.hasNext()) {
230                    // preload the next result chunk
231                    batchResult = loadChunk();
232
233                    // recurse to ensure we actually got elements
234                    return hasNext();
235                }
236
237                return false;
238            }
239
240            @Override
241            public Object next() {
242                if (closed) {
243                    throw new IllegalStateException("closed");
244                }
245                if (!hasNext()) {
246                    throw new NoSuchElementException();
247                }
248                return batchResult.next();
249            }
250
251            @Override
252            public StatementContext getContext() {
253                return batchResult.getContext();
254            }
255
256            @Override
257            public void close() {
258                closed = true;
259                batchResult.close();
260            }
261        }
262
263        ResultIterator<Object> result;
264
265        if (batchArgs.hasNext()) {
266            result = new BatchChunkIterator();
267        } else {
268            // only created to get access to the context.
269            PreparedBatch dummy = handle.prepareBatch(sql);
270            result = new ResultIterator<Object>() {
271                @Override
272                public void close() {
273                    // no op
274                }
275
276                @Override
277                public StatementContext getContext() {
278                    return dummy.getContext();
279                }
280
281                @Override
282                public boolean hasNext() {
283                    return false;
284                }
285
286                @Override
287                public Object next() {
288                    throw new NoSuchElementException();
289                }
290            };
291        }
292
293        ResultIterable<Object> iterable = ResultIterable.of(result);
294
295        return magic.mappedResult(iterable, result.getContext());
296    }
297
298    private Iterator<Object[]> zipArgs(Method method, Object[] args) {
299        boolean foundIterator = false;
300        List<Iterator<?>> extras = new ArrayList<>();
301        for (int paramIdx = 0; paramIdx < method.getParameterCount(); paramIdx++) {
302            final boolean singleValue = method.getParameters()[paramIdx].isAnnotationPresent(SingleValue.class);
303            final Object arg = args[paramIdx];
304            if (!singleValue && IterableLike.isIterable(arg)) {
305                extras.add(IterableLike.of(arg));
306                foundIterator = true;
307            } else {
308                extras.add(Stream.generate(() -> arg).iterator());
309            }
310        }
311
312        if (!foundIterator) {
313            throw new UnableToCreateStatementException("@SqlBatch method has no Iterable or array parameters,"
314                    + " did you mean @SqlQuery?", null, null);
315        }
316
317        return new Iterator<Object[]>() {
318            @Override
319            public boolean hasNext() {
320                for (Iterator<?> extra : extras) {
321                    if (!extra.hasNext()) {
322                        return false;
323                    }
324                }
325                return true;
326            }
327
328            @Override
329            public Object[] next() {
330                final Object[] argsArray = new Object[args.length];
331                for (int i = 0; i < extras.size(); i++) {
332                    argsArray[i] = extras.get(i).next();
333                }
334                return argsArray;
335            }
336        };
337    }
338
339    private ResultIterator<?> executeBatch(final Handle handle, final Supplier<PreparedBatch> preparedBatchSupplier) {
340        if (!handle.isInTransaction() && sqlBatch.transactional()) {
341            // it is safe to use same prepared preparedBatchSupplier as the inTransaction passes in the same
342            // Handle instance.
343            return handle.inTransaction(c -> batchIntermediate.apply(preparedBatchSupplier.get()));
344        } else {
345            return batchIntermediate.apply(preparedBatchSupplier.get());
346        }
347    }
348
349    private static boolean returnTypeIsValid(Class<?> type) {
350        if (type.equals(Void.TYPE)) {
351            return true;
352        }
353
354        if (type.isArray()) {
355            Class<?> componentType = type.getComponentType();
356            return componentType.equals(Integer.TYPE) || componentType.equals(Boolean.TYPE);
357        }
358
359        return false;
360    }
361
362    private static String invalidReturnTypeMessage(Method method) {
363        return method.getDeclaringClass() + "." + method.getName()
364                + " method is annotated with @SqlBatch so should return void, int[], or boolean[] but is returning: "
365                + method.getReturnType();
366    }
367
368    private interface ChunkSizeFunction {
369        int call(Object[] args);
370    }
371
372    private static class ConstantChunkSizeFunction implements SqlBatchHandler.ChunkSizeFunction {
373        private final int value;
374
375        ConstantChunkSizeFunction(int value) {
376            this.value = value;
377        }
378
379        @Override
380        public int call(Object[] args) {
381            return value;
382        }
383    }
384
385    private static class ParamBasedChunkSizeFunction implements SqlBatchHandler.ChunkSizeFunction {
386        private final int index;
387
388        ParamBasedChunkSizeFunction(int index) {
389            this.index = index;
390        }
391
392        @Override
393        public int call(Object[] args) {
394            return (Integer) args[index];
395        }
396    }
397}
